text.text_translated:
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we see the first signs of human society.
For example, people made paintings in caves.
No one knows if language was part of this.
Their brains did not suddenly get bigger.
But people became more intelligent.
Their lives were not simple.
So, we have a question.
Did language help their brains to get better?
Or did their better brains start to make language?
